citations.narrative:
On December 6, 2023, the facility self-reported the following event to the Office of Laboratory Animal Welfare (OLAW).
On December 3, 2023, an animal caretaker entered a swine housing room that contained farrowing crates with two sows
and their litters. The room had flooded because the pit drain was plugged but the pit flush valve was left open. Four
piglets were found dead. The room was drained, and the sows and surviving piglets were dried, and it was determined
that they did not need any further medical care. To avoid incidents such as this from happening again, the facility must
ensure that all daily care for the animals and their enclosures is done in a manner that they are protected from injury or
harm. The facility has replaced the drain plug with a re-designed plug that allows water to drain before the pit fills and
overflows into the room. The issue was corrected prior to the time of the inspection.
Corrected Date: April 23,2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
